job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Joplin, MO
pros: Great Insurance, great hours, etc.
cons: Bullying, condescension, snide remarks, unprofessional management staff, rude and disrespectful of other employees.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant/Phlebotomist in Joplin, MO
pros: Some kind coworkers. Sometimes early out on Fridays.
cons: When you are hired for this position as a medical assistant, you are not hired to work in the clinic you applied for. You are hired on as a float. When you are interviewed they will tell you that they will try to keep you in one place for as long as possible, several weeks if they can. They won't. They will also tell you that if the job doesn't suit you, you can ask to be switched to a more permanent position. This is also untrue. This means that you will end up going to a different clinic every day, sometimes two clinics in one day, or have an impromptu hour long drive to a far away clinic without notice. It gets very exhausting and stressful. While you may be a completely competent medical assistant, every clinic and every doctor wants you to do it a very specific and different way. You are expected to know this when you walk in. If you calmly question anything, or say that you have a preference you get accused of having an attitude and get in trouble. If you're a naturally quiet person they accuse you of not being welcoming enough, and then you once again get in trouble. The whole time you will be walking on egg shells. They will lie to you in the interview and say that you can keep your piercings and tattoos. Then when they float you they will say you have to take everything out and cover it despite every other "more established" coworker having them. If your kids get sick, and then you get sick from your kids, be prepared to have an intense guilt trip. You will also be docked multiple points via their disciplinary point system. Do not work here if you do not have a healthy support system to take over for your kids when they are sick. Overall, the turnover rate is enormous for good reason. They create a horribly stressful environment for new employees and when the employees are burnt out they are not supported.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Joplin, MO

review_title: Very poor upper management in IT!
pros:
Good company if you work for the right department.
Okay benefits. Decent PTO.  Good retirement plan.
Issues stated in "Cons" should not be reflected on the company itself.  Freeman is a good company and I enjoyed working there, they just have lots of issues in the IT department.  The IT department was a great place before 2014 until the new CIO arrived.
Also...I have no personal issue with the CIO...he is just really bad at management and should be in a different field.
cons:
Upper management in IT is the worst I have seen!  The CIO has no clue what he is doing or what his department supports.  He knows just enough to BS the administrative staff.
The "Support Center" Supervisor is horrible.  Manages by bullying his staff, which apparently the CIO is in favor of.  This individual has ran off approximately 90% of current staff when he was placed in the position and is still doing it...also, purposely causes issues with other IT departments!  WARNING...If you are looking to get into IT...DO NOT GO HERE!!!

pros: Benefits, job stability, bonuses, like the actual job
cons: Coordinator has created a toxic work environment, employees are not held accountable, poor wages.

pros: The benefits and PTO accrues quickly
cons: Management is horrible, organizational culture is horrible, and employees are unappreciated and undervalued, the pay is poor.

review_title: Always gave more than 100% of myself, but that was never enough to satisfy my supervisor.
pros: I love working with my co-workers as a team and interacting with patients.  They all are a big part of my family and friends.
cons: Regardless of the level of education, work experience and the many years of devoted service I've given them I was never ever able to move up to a better paying job or be considered for a promotion.  I have applied for so many different positions over the years that I was qualified for and didn't even get considered that I have come to the conclusion that it's not what you know, but who you know that gets you where you want to go for this company.  They pay you just enough to keep you where you're at because they know you can't find another job somewhere else in the same town for any better wage.  Also, the stress level is very high at all times because they insist on you doing more work with less help.

pros: Family oriented/feel. Focus on employees

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Joplin, MO
pros: flexible schedules and friendly environment
cons: Pay is not as competitive

job_title: Accounts Payable Clerk in Joplin, MO
pros: Decent pay. Yearly raise, Christmas bonus and yearly bonus.
cons: You cannot under any circumstances be an individual. This place is full of judgemental snooty people. I'm not covered in tattoos or have an unnatural hair color. I'm not thin and that's a problem. They treat you like crap if you ever use the elevator or don't run marathons. No smoking anywhere. Even in your own car 1000's of feet from the door. They want to have complete control over every second of your life. Even when you aren't there. No holiday pay. They tell you that you get holiday pay. They take it out of your pto which is only 18 days a year already. If you're a parent don't expect to be able to take any days off except for sick kids, holidays and doctor appointments. Favoritism runs rampant. If you complain its brushed off. Some people get promotions because of who they are friends with.

review_title: Freeman Health System, a good place to develop your professional skills
pros: Opportunity for growth & development.  Opportunity to supplement your income through extra shifts, including additional income through Home Health visits/PRN, weekend coverage at Freeman West, East, Neosho, Landmark.  Opportunity for career ladder, and continuing education.  Staff relationships and focus on patient care and patient satisfaction.  Outcomes are important, but do not  superceed the quality of care being provided.
cons: The way middle management is set up, ensures some potential lack of communication between all campuses and services provided.  The organization could benefit from a single individual overseeing all therapy services.  The hospital has the potential to waste funds through redundancy of services.  Each hospital area has a director of rehab services (Outpatient, Inpatient, Neosho) but there is some internal competition for services rendered.

review_title: Ozark Center leaves a lot to be desired as an employer
job_title: Medical Records Clerk (Ozark Center) in Joplin, MO
pros: Freeman's great reputation, good leadership at the executive level, acceptable and fairly-priced insurance plans for employees, client-positive culture.
cons: Unusually low wages for nonclinical staff (especially at Ozark Center), poor organization, dark ages technology standards for Ozark Center, hands off supervisory staff, critical lack of cohesion between Ozark Center and Freeman health systems.

review_title: Good experience in the hospital setting!
pros: I worked with a really great team of nurses.  Always felt comfortable asking questions if I wasn't sure about somthing.  Learned alot and the department I worked in was good about encouraging their nurses to advance their knowledge and provided various opportunities to do this.  They pay for all your required and most optional certifications!
cons: Politics that come with working in a large company.  Pay could be better, but after recent budget changes, is adequate.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Joplin, MO
pros: Very good work environment! Good moral and encouragement from management within Professional Support. Wonderful Doctors on staff who appreciate their nurses. Benefits are decent while some are pricey.
cons: Pay is very poor for licensed nurses compared to surrounding hospitals, even though they tell you they compare. LPN's are not treated very nicely by staff within Freeman-only from Professional Support. They are not recognized at all during nurses week. But Freeman does not do anything special for nurses during nurses week. This is the first company I have worked for that as a nurse I was not recognized during nurses week with a special gift or Bar-b-q.

review_title: Overall pretty good place to work
pros: I worked for Freeman while I was in college.  It was a pretty decent paying job for a college student and they were flexible with my school hours.  I worked for a wonderful doctor, but the office manager was a different story.  Overall, I think it was a great place to get my feet wet, but I didn't go to college to be a receptionist.  I left there for a job in my field of study.  The one problem I did have is that my title was "Receptionist" but I did so much more than that.  It was a good learning experience for me.
cons: I had a lot of responsibilies considering the title and the pay.

review_title: A great place to work and gain skills.
pros: All in all Freeman has great benefits, and depending on the department, a low drama factor.
cons: There is a lot of favoritism and you normally don't find out about changes until after they start.  Policies are changed on a weekly basis.

review_title: Love the patients, not the management.
pros:
Staff! Some of the greatest co-workers.
The department I work in is normally TEAM oriented for better patient care. 
Lunch breaks are almost guarenteed.
cons: Upper managements attempt to encourage staff retention while at the same time cutting pay and benifits. CEO stating that compensation to hospital for services provided are being cut dramatically, while at the same time trying to explain that he truly does not make 1.8 million dollars in pay, benefits, and bonuses. This is a difficult concept to understand.

pros: I worked with good people who gave me an opportunity to prove myself in a field I had never worked in before. I learned everything quickly and was able to excel in my job. I am thankful for the management that seen my potential and gave me the experience.
cons: I felt like the pay was too low for what was expected in the position. The doctors did not show appreciation for their staff as a whole, and did not appreciate how hard the staff worked to keep their clinics running smoothly.

review_title: I truly enjoyed working at Freeman Health System.
pros:
- recognition from peers
- recognition from my own boss (who would pass along to make sure her boss (the CEO) found out about it
- great culture and environment 
- transparency with senior management to staff (aka when health care reform happened, CEO and senior leadership were VERY clear with what was going on, why it mattered, where the funding cuts were coming from, what it meant to employees, and why it depended on employees to make or break budget)
cons:
- Mnimum pay -- could make more money in similar job just about anywhere, including Joplin and including across the street. 
- Was only there for 2 years, and one year bonuses weren't given

review_title: Wonderful company to clients, not so much so to the employees.
pros:
Assertive treatment movements for clients served.  
Successful treatment programs.  
Caring staff and administration. 
Professional staff and therapy profession.
Corrective action process is designed to train and correct staff behavior rather than just consequence.
cons:
Little recognition for entry level employees.
Few chances of advancing in company.
Consistently understaffed and underpaid.
Overworked and under trained. 
Physical buildings are under-maintained. Borderline out of code.

pros:
Love working with my team for the most part.  
Close to home.
Flexible time off.
Optional 4 day work week in IT.
Direct supervisor is great.
cons:
Poor IT managers.
Poor upper management.
Poor raises.
Pay well below market rate.
Technical decisions made by non technical people.

A large portion of IT is non-technical and refuses to do even non-technical work claiming it is technical.  This is ironic considering they work in information TECHnology.

New employees are sometimes brought on higher than current employees.

Benefits are more expensive than many competitors.

Lack of accountability with incompetent and low performance employees.

No sick days.

Modest PTO policy.

Employer only matches 3% of retirement contributions.

All this while tax documents reveal several people making over a million dollars a year in addition to high pay for executives.

pros: They hired me as a new graduate and most of the younger nurses I worked with there were great.
cons:
I was bullied by older nurses CONSTANTLY. Management played favorites, and refused to intervene when I would go to them with concerns. So many horrible things happened there since no one knew what they were doing because the older nurses were such terrible people that none of the new nurses learned anything from them and we didn't feel comfortable asking for help. We just had to kind of figure it out for ourselves. Not that the experienced nurses knew anything, anyway, they were nearly as incompetent as the brand new nurses, and too stuck up to ask for any help even when their patients were obviously crashing. Comforting thought when you're taking your loved ones there for care, isn't it? 
This place should be shut down. There isn't enough money in the world that could get me to go back. I would rather flush my nursing license down the toilet, and if I had a loved one who had to go to the hospital I would take them to Mercy or care for them myself and drive to Kansas City before I took them to this death trap. The day I left this hell hole forever was one of the best days of my entire life. The really cute part is, THEY THINK THEY'RE A GOOD HOSPITAL! They talk about how great they are literally ALL THE TIME. I didn't know the difference until I went to a different hospital that was actually a great hospital.

pros: Nothing is positive with the upper management
cons:
Company looks at employees as just a number. I worked there for 9 years and received 2 years with in those years. Not only do they treat their employees horrible they patient care has declined due to the not focusing on having adequate staffing numbers. Talented employees were leaving to find better jobs. Not enough people to cover the amount of patients. Employee burn out was a constant. As a patient I would NEVER go there knowing what is going on behind the scenes. CRITICAL CARE-TURN YOUR CAR AROUND GO TO MERCY!! 
Upper management is inept and I would tell an individual looking for a job in the area to look else where.

review_title: A decent place to work if you are not looking for advancement

2. Depending on your supervisor, some will work with your work schedule
3. In general, job are quite secure as long as you don't break the rules
cons:

2. Low salary increase
3. Management can be appreciative but does not give out bonuses

review_title: I had a very disappointing experience working for Freeman Health System

pros: They gave me time off when I asked.  They provided pay for bereavement.  They were "people friendly" but had their own agenda for being so, unfortunately.
cons: The stress was extreme and there was not enough empathy between colleagues when relating to stress especially after the Joplin Tornado.  For example all that was done within the system to attempt to increase morale after the tornado was to give us a free t-shirt! and we were "allowed" to wear them every friday.  Free advertising for them, for us nothing more than we could get supporting a local band. The benefits weren't explained well during orientation, and they weren't great compared to what I'm used to.  The pay was not good either.  The facility I worked needed repairs.
